text:
Log4j contains standard classes which provide JMS functionality.

To compile these classes the Sun JMS 1.1 implementation must be downloaded manually and added to the maven repository.  The JMS specification is also implemented in Apache Geronimo and is available in Maven.

The attached pom.xml contains the three changes needed to download the Geronimo JMS specification implementation and disregard the Sun ditto (which is pom.xml only).

I have not attached a patch as the Eclipse SVN diff does not disregard white space.  Sigh.
creator: thorbjoern@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 22342
diff of pom.xml provided by Thorbjørn (whitespace removed)
creator: psmith@apache.org
psmith@apache.org
text: maybe I'm missing something but we still have to declare a dependency on the com.sun.jdmk.jmxtools artifact, so while this appears as a nice to have, doesn't _really_ get us much further does it?
IIUC, the proposal in bug 45485 would then obviate the the need to even have the jmxtools dependency too, is that the intent Thorbørn?
creator: psmith@apache.org

text:
(In reply to comment #4)
> IIUC, the proposal in bug 45485 would then obviate the the need to even have
> the jmxtools dependency too, is that the intent Thorbørn?

Yes.  Pull out of SVN and build.

This issue is about JMS not JMX (I guess Sun has a guy who is really really bad at Scrabble who is responsible for their project names).
creator: thorbjoern@gmail.com

text:
Committed in revision 681536.

I added back the missing <optional> marked for this dependency so we don't add unneeded transitive dependencies to people.
Added change notice and modified build.xml to use geronimo-jms.jar preferentially in rev 682913.
creator: carnold@apache.org
